page.title: 04Ecology,Footpaths,Wildlife.
page.content: {Nine footpaths have recently been re_ {signposted by Tynedale District {Council using the Manpower Services {Scheme.Unfortunately,many of these {footpaths no longer exist as they have {been ploughed or incorporated into {gardens. A good deal of felling and replanting is taking place in the area_a Silver Medal Certificate_ awarded by the Royal Agricultural Society of England has been given to a local landowner for his contribution towards conservation in preserving Oak and other hardwood trees and the replanting and replenishing of hardwoods and other trees native to the area eg.Rowan and Birch. The area is rich in wildlife and there are many Badgers,Foxes,Red Squirrels,Roe_deer and Bats of many
